summary: This document is an email chain from May 29, 2020, discussing the Netflix documentary about Jeffrey Epstein. The correspondents share their initial thoughts on the documentary's pacing and content, and mention the renewed public interest and pressure the documentary's release brings. They also discuss operational delays due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

persons.name: Graydon Carter
persons.context: Mentioned as someone who could have written a better statement than the one shown at the end of episode 1 of the Netflix documentary.

events.title: Release of Netflix Epstein documentary
events.description: A new Netflix documentary series about Jeffrey Epstein is released, generating renewed public interest and discussion.

events.title: COVID-19 pandemic delays investigations
events.description: The COVID-19 pandemic is cited as a reason for delaying decisions or actions regarding other individuals related to the Epstein case, as they are not considered ongoing threats to public safety.

keyFacts: The email discusses a new Netflix documentary about Jeffrey Epstein, with criticism of its pacing and a specific statement shown at the end of episode 1.
The correspondents note the documentary's release has created a 'buzz in the air' and renewed energy and pressure regarding the Epstein case.
Investigative decisions regarding other individuals in the Epstein case are reportedly delayed due to the COVID-19 pandemic, as they are not considered immediate public safety threats.
The document is an internal email chain, indicating ongoing private discussion about the public narrative and operational aspects of the Epstein case in May 2020.
